intro: Daphnopsis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered leaves and delicate white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
